meanings.definition: Sly: having or showing a cunning and deceitful nature
meanings.sent1: The slier fox quietly approached the henhouse.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a slier smile before revealing her true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The slier cat pretended to be asleep while waiting to pounce on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His slier tactics in the game made him a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: The slier character in the story always had a hidden agenda.

meanings.definition: Slyly: in a cunning or deceitful manner
meanings.sent1: She slyly winked at him to signal the plan was in motion.
meanings.sent2: He slyly slipped the note into her bag without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent3: The magician slyly made the coin disappear behind his back.
meanings.sent4: The spy slyly gathered information without raising any suspicion.
meanings.sent5: The thief slyly pocketed the diamond and vanished into the crowd.

meanings.definition: Slyness: the quality of being cunning or deceitful
meanings.sent1: His slyness was evident in the way he always seemed to know more than he let on.
meanings.sent2: The detective admired the criminal's slyness but was determined to outsmart him.
meanings.sent3: The slyness of the raccoon stealing food from the campsite amused the campers.
meanings.sent4: Her slyness in negotiations earned her the reputation of a shrewd businesswoman.
meanings.sent5: The slyness of the old owl in catching its prey was a sight to behold.
